attributes.action: intervene in the case of Paul Clarke, who is to be jailed for handing in a shotgun
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Paul Clarke, a former soldier living in Merstham, found a sawn-off shotgun dumped in his back garden with some live ammunition.

He took it to the Police station and handed it in.  He was arrested for possession of a firearm.  He was found guilty of this charge on 10th November 2009, and is to be sentenced on December  11th.

The minimum term available to the judge is five years imprisonment.

It is scandalous than a man doing his civic duty should pay for that with a five year term in prison.  Gun crime is very serious, and the penalties should be harsh.  Mr Clarke was trying to reduce gun crime.  This does not deserve any sort of penalty.  He should be pardoned as soon as possible.

The story is reported here:

http://www.thisissurreytoday.co.uk/news/Ex-soldier-faces-jail-handing-gun/article-1509082-detail/article.html
